sentences.text: 2016 Performance at a Glance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We Are Transforming Our Company
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we continued to focus and make progress on our five strategic initiatives: drive revenue growth through segmented market roles,  make disciplined brand and growth investments, drive efficiency through aggressive productivity, streamline and simplify, and focus on our  core business model.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Achievements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Expanded our operating margin through 3% price/mix growth and balancing productivity with disciplined investments
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advanced our strategy to grow revenues in our sparkling  portfolio, through actions including the Coca-Cola one-brand  strategy and an integrated marketing campaign
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continued momentum in developed markets, led by North  America which grew net operating revenues by 4%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Delivered over $600 million in productivity, which drove operating  margin expansion
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Remained committed and consumer-focused in developing and  emerging markets amidst persistent macroeconomic pressures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Strengthened our global bottling system for the long term  with strategic actions taken in North America, Latin America,  Europe, Africa and Asia
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Introduced 500+ new products into the market worldwide,  including the successful launch of smartwater and Honest Tea in  Western Europe
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On track to complete refranchising of our Company-owned  bottling operations in the U.S. by the end of 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continued to expand our growing portfolio through strategic  investments, including fairlife milk in the U.S. and Chi, Nigerias  leading value-added dairy and juice company

sentences.text: Our Compensation Philosophy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While we consider a number of factors in our pay decisions, we are guided by three core principles:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay for Performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The great majority of pay for  executives should be at-risk and performance-based  with metrics aligned to the Companys financial results  and business strategy and have a clear connection to the  employees individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consider the Coca-Cola system.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our employees are  required to operate and have influence in the context of  our broad and complex global Coca-Cola system, which  includes our independent bottling partners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the  Company had approximately $42 billion in reported net  operating revenues in 2016, the Coca-Cola system generates more than $100 billion in revenues, operates in over 200  countries and employs more than 700,000 people.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our  executives and employees must not only manage our  business but also support our bottlers and other partners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This alignment and a shared vision of success are critical to  drive long-term growth.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Maintain programs that will attract and retain  critical talent, while reinforcing a high-performing  and accountable culture.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation programs should be competitive in the marketplace and designed to  retain talent over the longer term, while holding employees  accountable to the Companys strategy and values.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 compensation decisions were approved for our Named Executive Officers as a result of Company and individual performance.

sentences.text: Chief Executive Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Muhtar Kent  Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Performance Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: KEY ACCOMPLISHMENTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: STRATEGIC AND BOARD LEADERSHIP
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Kent set the groundwork for continued transformative change as the Company refocuses on its core business model of building strong  global brands, enhancing sustainable customer value and leading a strong, dedicated franchise system.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As Chairman of the Board,  Mr. Kent continued to lead the Board effectively and actively engage Directors and Committee Chairs in all aspects of the business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He  created open lines of communication between Directors and management, including through meetings between Directors and Company  leaders around the world.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: REFRANCHISING
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Kent led efforts to achieve our goal to refranchise our U.S. bottling operations by the end of 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We signed definitive agreements  to refranchise our Company-owned bottling operations in China, furthered the evolution of Coca-Cola Beverages Africa, completed the  creation of Coca-Cola European Partners and supported the ongoing transformation of the franchising bottling system in Japan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ORDERLY LEADERSHIP SUCCESSION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Kent led a very orderly CEO leadership transition process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 was the first full year of James Quincey serving as President and Chief  Operating Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Kent personally saw to the successful onboarding of Mr. Quincey in his new role, leading to the announcement in  December 2016 that Mr. Quincey would succeed Mr. Kent as CEO in May 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SUSTAINABILITY FOCUS AREAS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WATER REPLENISHMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company and its global bottling partners achieved 115% water replenishment, becoming the first Fortune 500 company to replenish all of the water it uses globally.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also achieved a water use ratio below 2.0 for the first time in Company history.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WOMEN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leadership and Diversity: Continued strong leadership in accelerating the development of diverse leadership talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continued to be  the executive sponsor of the Womens Leadership Council.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the executive sponsor of the Womens Leadership Council.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Economically Empowering Women: Our 5by20 initiative had enabled more than 1.2 million women entrepreneurs across our global  value chain through the end of 2015, with additional progress in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WELL-BEING
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Led significant progress in innovations focused on reduced, low and no-calorie products, with over 500 reformulation initiatives  underway to reduce added sugar in our beverages.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Choice of Incentive Metrics
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The key financial metrics in our incentive plans (net operating  revenue, profit before tax, volume and economic profit growth)  align with our strategy for long-term value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we enhanced the target-setting process to test  the robustness of our already strong incentive targets and  performance curve setting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We make certain adjustments when calculating results, such  as for the impact of foreign currency exchange rates, changes  in financial accounting reporting regulations, and costs  and other financial implications associated with corporate  transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The setting of our performance curves considered the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance levels necessary to achieve our long-term  goals and deliver superior shareowner returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The likelihood of achieving various levels of performance  based on historical results over a ten-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our targets are currency neutral because we believe incentive  targets should measure the underlying results of the business  and that business leaders should be encouraged to make  decisions that drive long-term sustainable growth rather than  to address short-term currency fluctuations or short-term and  nonrecurring items.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This philosophy has been in place for  several years, and we review this issue regularly, as it is an  important concern for companies like ours with significant  exposure to foreign currency exchange rate fluctuations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Metrics, program designs and results at companies in our  comparator group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance relative to our comparator companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have added a standing meeting each year to devote  additional time to this important process.

sentences.text: * Profit before tax growth and net operating revenue growth are calculated after adjusting for the impact of currency and certain nonrecurring items affecting comparability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These measures differ  from profit before tax growth and net operating revenue growth reported under GAAP, primarily due to the impact of currency, asset impairments/restructuring, productivity and reinvestment  program, net charges by equity investees, transaction gains/losses and other items.

sentences.text: In addition, these measures are calculated after adjusting for the impact of structural items.

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee sets ranges for long-term incentive  compensation for each job grade at the senior executive levels.

sentences.text: The ranges were informed by a survey of our comparator groups  and similar companies pay practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation  Committee does not target a specific percentile ranking against  our comparator group and may grant long-term incentive awards  at the higher end of the range for a variety of factors, including  individual performance and to reflect support of the larger  Coca-Cola system.

sentences.text: Long-Term Incentive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once the value of the long-term incentive award is determined,  the Compensation Committee grants a portion of the award  in stock options and a portion in PSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When determining the  number of stock options awarded, a Black-Scholes value is first  calculated and, beginning in 2015 and continuing in 2016, a  floor and ceiling are applied based on a 30-day average stock  price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This stock option guardrail increases predictability, helps  manage the burn rate commitment and is intended to mitigate  against excessively high and low Black-Scholes values.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For stock  option grants in 2016, the low end of our guardrail was used,  which valued options at 20% of the 30-day average stock price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This resulted in fewer stock options actually being granted than  the pure Black-Scholes model would have suggested.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PSUs are  valued based on a 30-day average stock price for purposes of  determining target award values.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, approximately  6,600 employees received long-term incentive compensation, of  which approximately 700 employees received equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual long-term incentive awards are made in February of each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A limited number of other awards may be granted throughout  the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to the rules for how the grant date fair value of long-term  incentive awards must be calculated for accounting purposes,  the 2016 Summary Compensation Table may not reflect the same  stock option and PSU values described above.

sentences.text: The Company repurchases additional  shares through its share repurchase program, which resulted  in a decrease in Common Stock outstanding in 2016.

sentences.text: The annual equity awards represent the vast majority of equity  awards granted during the year.

sentences.text: Overhang primarily includes outstanding awards granted under  plans (Prior Plans) in place prior to adoption of The Coca-Cola  Company 2014 Equity Plan, as amended (the 2014 Equity Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards from Prior Plans that expire or are forfeited will not be  issued or available for future issuance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overhang will decline  each year as equity awards are exercised or realized, and as  awards from Prior Plans expire or are forfeited.

sentences.text: How We Make Compensation Decisions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Decision-Making Process and Role of  Executive Officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareowner Engagement and Results of 2016  Advisory Vote on Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has a long-standing shareowner outreach program and  routinely interacts with shareowners about executive compensation  and other matters (see page 31).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareowners are also given an  opportunity to provide feedback through an advisory vote on executive  compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews and discusses the Boards  evaluation of the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer and  makes preliminary determinations about base salary, annual  incentive and long-term equity compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation  Committee then discusses the compensation recommendations  with its independent consultant and the full Board, and approves  final compensation decisions after these discussions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the 2016 Annual Meeting of Shareowners, approximately 96%  of the votes cast were in favor of the advisory vote to approve  executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee took  into account these results as well as feedback received from  shareowners during our engagements when making the decisions  described in this Compensation Discussion and Analysis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For other Named Executive Officers, the Chairman and Chief  Executive Officer considers performance, experience, pay  history and competitive market data, and makes individual  recommendations to the Compensation Committee on base  salary, annual incentive and long-term equity compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews, discusses, modifies and  approves, as appropriate, these compensation recommendations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareowners, we are again holding  an advisory vote to approve executive compensation (see page 43)  and will continue to consider the results of the advisory vote and  engage with our shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As required, we also are holding  a vote on the frequency of holding the advisory vote, which we  are recommending to continue holding annually (see page 76).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee uses several resources and tools,  including competitive market information and tally sheets,  which quantify each of the compensation elements as well as  accumulated outstanding long-term equity awards and deferred  compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Share Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Named Executive Officers meet or exceed their share ownership  guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Share ownership guidelines align the executives long-term  financial interests with those of shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ownership guidelines, which cover approximately 60  executives, are as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role Value of Common Stock to be Owned* Chief Executive Officer 8 times base salary Chief Operating Officer and Operating Business Presidents 5 times base salary Executive Vice Presidents, Group Presidents and President of Coca-Cola Refreshments 4 times base salary Other senior executives 2 times base salary Business Unit Presidents below senior executive level 1 times base salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: * Shares are valued based on the average closing price of Common Stock for the prior one-year period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options do not count toward the ownership guidelines and PSUs count only after the performance criteria have been met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committee also may mandate the retention of 100% of net shares,  after settlement of taxes and transaction fees, acquired pursuant  to equity awards granted on or after January 1, 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To ensure compliance with the guidelines, the Compensation  Committee may direct that up to 50% of the annual cash incentive  be withheld if an executive is not compliant.

sentences.text: In addition to any clawbacks required by law, regulation or  applicable listing standards, the clawback provisions allow  the Company to recoup payments if an employee or former  employee engages in certain prohibited activities, which include  violation of any Company policy, including the Companys Code  of Business Conduct, disclosing confidential information or trade  secrets, accepting employment competing against the Company  or soliciting Company employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive officers must retain 50% of the shares (after paying  taxes) obtained from option exercises or from the release of  PSUs, restricted stock units or restricted stock awards until the  earlier of one year after exercise/release of shares or separation  from the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These plans provide for basic retirement needs and  serve as a safety net to protect against the financial catastrophes  that can result from illness, disability or death.

sentences.text: Tax and Accounting Implications  of Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys annual and long-term incentive plans have  been structured with the intent of enabling the Compensation  Committee to grant compensation that constitutes qualified  performance-based compensation under Section 162(m) of the  Tax Code, if the Compensation Committee determines to do so.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, all annual incentive payments to the Named Executive  Officers were deducted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax and accounting implications are considered, but they are  not the only factors considered.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other important considerations  outweigh tax or accounting considerations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Tax Code limits deductibility of certain  compensation to $1 million per year for the Chief Executive Officer  and the three other executive officers (other than the Chief Financial  Officer) who are the highest paid and employed at year-end.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If  certain conditions are met, performance-based compensation  may be excluded from this limitation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally under GAAP, compensation is expensed as earned.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity compensation is expensed in accordance with ASC  Topic 718, which is generally over the vesting period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Aircraft Usage
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Infrequently, spouses and guests of Named Executive Officers  ride along on the Company aircraft when the aircraft is already  going to a specific destination for a business purpose.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This  use has minimal cost to the Company and, where applicable,  a nominal amount is included in the All Other Compensation  table above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Income is imputed to the Named Executive Officer  for income tax purposes, but no tax reimbursement is provided  since such persons are not traveling for a business purpose.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company owns and operates business aircraft to allow employees  to safely and efficiently travel for business purposes around the  world.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given the Companys significant global presence, we believe  it is a business imperative for senior leaders to be on the ground at  our global operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company aircraft allow employees to be  far more productive than if commercial flights were utilized, as the  aircraft provide a confidential and highly productive environment in  which to conduct business without the schedule constraints imposed  by commercial airline service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining the incremental cost to the Company of personal  use of the Company aircraft, the Company calculates, for each  aircraft, the direct variable operating costs on an hourly basis,  including all costs that may vary by the hours flown.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Items included  in calculating this cost are as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company aircraft are made available to the Named Executive  Officers for their personal use in the following situations:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company aircraft is the Boards strongly preferred method for  all travel by Mr. Kent, for both business and personal travel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This  is for security purposes due to the high profile and global nature  of our business and our highly symbolic and well-recognized  brands, as well as to ensure that he can be immediately available  to respond to business priorities from any location around the  world.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This arrangement also allows travel time to be used  productively for the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Kent and his immediate family  traveling with him use the Company aircraft for a reasonable  number of personal trips.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Personal use of the Company aircraft  results in imputed taxable income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Kent is not provided a tax  reimbursement for personal use of aircraft.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the same reasons,  personal use of the Company aircraft is permitted for Mr. Quincey  as President and Chief Operating Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: aircraft fuel and oil;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: logistics (landing fees, permits, etc.);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: telecommunication expenses and other supplies; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the amount, if any, of disallowed tax deductions associated  with such use.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When the aircraft is already flying to a destination for business  purposes, only the direct variable costs associated with the additional  passenger (for example, catering) are included in determining the  aggregate incremental cost to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While it happens very  rarely, if an aircraft flies empty before picking up or after dropping off  a passenger flying for personal reasons, this deadhead segment  would be included in the incremental cost.

sentences.text: Mr. Kent is provided with a car and driver in the U.S. both for security  purposes and to maximize his efficiency during business hours.

sentences.text: The Company provides benefits to globally mobile associates under  various international service programs, the material provisions of  which are described on page 93.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These programs are designed to  relocate and support employees who are sent on an assignment  outside of their home country.

sentences.text: The purpose of the programs is to  make sure that when the Company requests that an employee move  outside his or her home country, economic considerations do not  play a role.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This helps the Company quickly meet its business needs  around the world and develop its employees.

sentences.text: PAYMENTS ON TERMINATION OR CHANGE IN CONTROL
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: General
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Most of the Companys plans and programs contain specific provisions  detailing how payments are treated upon termination or change in  control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The specific termination and change in control provisions  under these plans, which are described below, apply to all participants
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: in each plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The termination scenarios described in this section  include voluntary separation, involuntary separation, disability  and death.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information on the plans described below,    see Summary of Plans in Annex B beginning on page 91.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 Proxy Statement    69
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The change in control provisions in the various Company plans were  adopted to mitigate the concern that, in the event the Company is  considering a change in control transaction, the employees involved  in considering the transaction might otherwise be motivated to act in  their own interests rather than the interests of the shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thus,  the change in control provisions are designed so that employees  are neither harmed nor given a windfall in the event of a change  in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys plans generally provide that a change in  control may occur upon (i) greater than a 20% change in ownership
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: of the Company,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) a change of the majority of the Board within a  two-year period or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) certain merger and consolidation transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described below, Company equity plans include double-trigger  change in control provisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does not have individual change in control agreements  and no tax gross-up is provided for any taxes incurred as a result  of a change in control payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board can determine prior to  the potential change in control that no change in control will be  deemed to have occurred.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Severance Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the Named Executive Officers are covered by a Company severance pay plan (the TCCC Severance Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Termination, Death, Disability
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, benefits are payable under the TCCC Severance Plan when an employee is terminated involuntarily due to specific circumstances,  such as an internal reorganization or position elimination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The maximum cash severance benefit under this plan is two years of base pay,  payable as a lump sum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For Mr. de Quinto, if terminated involuntarily other than for cause, he is entitled to receive two times the amount of  his base salary that exceeds $750,000 at the time of separation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There are no separate change in control provisions included in the TCCC Severance Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Incentive Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the Named Executive Officers participated in the annual Performance Incentive Plan in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Termination, Death, Disability
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, participants employed on December 31 are eligible to receive a cash incentive for the year, regardless of whether employment  continues through the payment date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an employee retires, dies or moves to an affiliate, he or she generally receives a prorated incentive  based on actual Company performance and the portion of the year actually worked.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon a change in control, participants receive the target amount of the annual incentive after the end of the performance year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This amount  is prorated if the participant leaves during the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Named Executive Officer chose to participate in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Termination
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The treatment of equity upon termination of employment depends on the reason for the termination and the employees age and length of  service at termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The chart below details the termination provisions of the various equity award types.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Award Type Separation Prior to Meeting Age/Service Requirement1 Separation After Meeting Age/Service Requirement1 Stock Options Employees have six months to exercise vested options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unvested options are forfeited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All options held at least 12 months vest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees have the full  remaining term to exercise the options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock/  Restricted Stock   Units Shares are forfeited unless held until the time specified in  the grant and performance measures, if any, are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares are forfeited unless held until the time specified in the grant  and performance measures, if any, are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some grants vest upon  meeting age and service requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PSUs All PSUs are forfeited if separation occurs prior to  satisfaction of performance measures and holding  requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For grants held at least 12 months, the employee receives the same  number of earned shares as active employees after the results are  certified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1 The age and service requirement is generally age 60 with at least ten years of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2012, the Compensation Committee approved a special equity program for employees who are at least  age 50 with at least ten years of service and are involuntarily terminated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This program provides
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) that outstanding stock options held at least 12 months will not be forfeited and continue to vest  according to the original vesting schedule and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) outstanding PSUs held at least 12 months will not be forfeited and a prorated amount will be released after the results are certified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive  officers are not eligible for this program without specific approval by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Named Executive Officer has been made eligible for the program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity plans and award  agreements were amended in February 2013 to apply these provisions to all grants beginning in 2013 for all eligible employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Death
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an employee dies, all options vest if the options have been accepted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For options granted prior to 2007, the employees estate has 12 months  from the date of death to exercise the options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For options granted in  and after 2007, the employees estate has five years from the date  of death to exercise the options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted stock and restricted stock  units vest and are released to the employees estate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For PSUs, if death  occurs during the performance period, the employees estate receives  a cash payment equal to the value of the target number of shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For  PSUs where performance has been certified, the employees estate  receives a cash payment based on the certified results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: stock units vest and are released to the employee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For PSUs in the  performance period, the employee receives shares equal to the  number of shares that the employee would have earned based on  actual performance after the end of the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For  PSUs where performance has been certified, earned shares are  released within 90 days.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning with awards in 2015, the treatment of equity upon a change  in control is governed by the 2014 Equity Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Awards granted prior to  2015 were governed by applicable plans and agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The chart  below details the double-trigger change in control provisions of the  various equity award types if awards are assumed by the successor  company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If awards are not assumed by the successor company,  accelerated vesting generally occurs upon a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If an employee terminates employment because of disability, all  options become nonforfeitable, and the employee has the full  original term to exercise the options.

sentences.text: Change in Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The TCCC Pension Plan and the TCCC Supplemental Pension Plan  contain change in control provisions that affect all participants equally,  including the participating Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These provisions  provide an enhanced benefit to vested participants for benefits  accrued under the defined benefit formula if certain conditions are  met, including that the employee must actually leave the Company  within two years of a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A change in control has no  effect on the cash balance portion of the TCCC Pension Plan and  there are no additional credited years of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon a change in  control under the TCCC Pension Plan and the TCCC Supplemental  Pension Plan, the earliest retirement age is reduced resulting in an  enhanced benefit for participants who have not reached the earliest  retirement age.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Termination, Death, Disability
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No payments may be made under the TCCC Pension Plan or the  TCCC Supplemental Pension Plan until an employee has separated  from service and met eligibility requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, no payments  may be made under the 401(k) Plan, the Supplemental 401(k) Plan or  the Mobile Plan until separation from service, except distributions  may be taken from the 401(k) Plan after age 59 and distributions  related to mandatory tax payments may be made under the Mobile  Plan, whether or not the employee has terminated employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 401(k) Plan, the Supplemental 401(k) Plan, the Mobile Plan, the  UK Savings Plan and the Spanish Savings Plan do not have special  provisions for change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Individuals who are designated as specified employees under Section  409A of the Tax Code, which include the U.S. based Named Executive  Officers, may not receive payments from the TCCC Supplemental  Pension Plan, the Supplemental 401(k) Plan or the Mobile Plan for at  least six months following termination of employment.

sentences.text: Under the 401(k) Plan, the Company matches employee contributions  up to a maximum of 3.5% of an employees compensation, subject  to limits imposed by the Tax Code.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 3 - Advisory Vote on the Frequency of Holding the Advisory Vote to Approve Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ITEM 3 -   ADVISORY VOTE ON THE FREQUENCY OF  HOLDING THE ADVISORY VOTE TO APPROVE  EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What am I voting on?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareowners are being provided the opportunity to vote on how often they believe we should hold an advisory vote to approve  executive compensation in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The frequency options are to hold the advisory vote to approve executive compensation  each year, every two years or every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting recommendation:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For holding the advisory vote to approve executive compensation EACH YEAR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that an annual advisory vote on executive compensation is the most appropriate policy for our shareowners and the Company at this time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the advisory vote to approve executive compensation, we  are also seeking a non-binding determination from our shareowners  as to how often they believe the advisory vote to approve executive  compensation should be held in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When this advisory vote  was last held in 2011, shareowners indicated a preference to hold  the advisory vote to approve executive compensation each year and  the Board implemented this standard.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regardless of the frequency of the advisory vote to approve executive  compensation, the Compensation Committee will remain committed  to considering feedback from shareowners as we continue to refine  and evaluate the Companys compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Board recommends an annual advisory vote to approve  executive compensation, the voting options are to hold the advisory  vote to approve executive compensation each year, every two years  or every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareowners may also abstain from voting on  this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board continues to believe that an annual advisory vote to  approve executive compensation is the most appropriate policy  for our shareowners and the Company at this time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although we  recognize the potential benefits of having less frequent advisory votes  to approve executive compensation, we understand that an annual  advisory vote is currently the standard desired by many shareowners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends a vote for holding the advisory  vote to approve executive compensation EACH YEAR.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AUDIT MATTERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: REPORT OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee operates under a written charter adopted  by the Board that outlines its responsibilities and the practices it  follows.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can view the charter on the Companys website, www.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: coca-colacompany.com, by clicking on Investors, then Corporate  Governance, then Board Committees & Charters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit  Committee reviews and assesses the adequacy of its charter at  least annually and, when appropriate, recommends changes to the  Board to reflect the evolving role of the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is composed of non-employee Directors who  meet the independence and financial literacy requirements of the  NYSE and additional, heightened independence criteria applicable  to members of the Audit Committee under SEC and NYSE rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  Board has designated Ronald W. Allen and David B. Weinberg as  Audit Committee financial experts under the SEC rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Primary Responsibilities and 2016 Actions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee represents and assists the Board in fulfilling its oversight responsibility relating to the integrity of the Companys financial statements and the financial reporting process, the systems of internal accounting and financial controls, the internal audit function and the annual independent audit of the Companys financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee oversees the Companys compliance with legal and regulatory requirements, the Independent Auditors qualifications and independence, the performance of the Companys internal audit function and the Independent Auditors, the Companys ethical compliance programs, including the Companys Codes of Business Conduct, and the Companys quality, safety, environmental assurance and information technology security programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also generally oversees the Companys overall enterprise risk management (ERM) program and has direct oversight over financial reporting and control and several other risks, noted below, within the ERM framework.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Audit Committee participates in educational sessions developed by management, at the request of the Audit Committee, on areas of the Companys operations, including some of the areas of risk it directly oversees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: received periodic updates on managements process to assess  the adequacy of the Companys system of internal control over  financial reporting, the framework used to make the assessment  and managements conclusions on the effectiveness of the  Companys internal control over financial reporting;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: discussed with the Independent Auditors the Companys internal  control assessment process, managements assessment with  respect thereto and the Independent Auditors evaluation of the  Companys system of internal control over financial reporting;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviewed and discussed with management and the Independent  Auditors the Companys earnings releases and quarterly and  annual reports on Form 10-Q and Form 10-K prior to filing with  the SEC;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviewed the Companys internal audit plan and the performance  of the Companys internal audit function;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviewed with senior members of the Companys financial  management team, the Independent Auditors and the Chief of  Internal Audit, the overall audit scope and plans, the results of  internal and external audits, evaluations by management and  the Independent Auditors of the Companys internal controls over  financial reporting and the quality of the Companys financial  reporting;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Audit Committee held 12 meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meeting agendas are established by the Audit Committees Chair and the Chief of Internal Audit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, among other things, the Audit Committee:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: met with the senior members of the Companys financial management team at each regularly scheduled meeting;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviewed with management, including the Chief of Internal Audit  and General Counsel, and the Independent Auditors, significant  risks and exposures identified by management, the overall  adequacy and effectiveness of the Companys legal, regulatory  and ethical compliance programs, including the Companys  Codes of Business Conduct, and the Companys quality, safety,  environmental assurance and information technology security  programs;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: held separate private sessions, during its regularly scheduled  meetings, with each of the Companys General Counsel, the  Independent Auditors, and the Chief of Internal Audit, at which  candid discussions regarding financial management, legal,  accounting, auditing and internal control issues took place;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: continued its long-standing practice of having independent  legal counsel, who regularly attends Audit Committee meetings;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: received regular updates from management and discussed the  Companys productivity and reinvestment program; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: met with the Chief Ethics and Compliance Officer to discuss the  effectiveness of the Companys compliance program and regularly  received status reports of compliance issues;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Oversight of Independent Auditors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee engaged Ernst & Young LLP as our Independent  Auditors for the year ended December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In its meetings with  representatives of the Independent Auditors, the Audit Committee  asks them to address, and discusses their responses to, several  questions that the Audit Committee believes are particularly relevant  to its oversight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the Independent Auditors experience, and their  knowledge of the Company, has the Company implemented  internal controls and internal audit procedures that are appropriate  for the Company?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee believes that using these questions to help  focus its discussions with the Independent Auditors promotes a more  meaningful dialogue that provides a basis for its oversight judgment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These questions include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also discussed with the Independent Auditors  those matters required to be discussed by the auditors with the  Audit Committee under the rules adopted by the Public Company  Accounting Oversight Board (the PCAOB).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee  received the written disclosures and the letter from the Independent  Auditors required by applicable requirements of the PCAOB regarding  the Independent Auditors communication with the Audit Committee  concerning independence, and has discussed with the Independent  Auditors their independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee considered with  the Independent Auditors whether the provision of non-audit services  provided by them to the Company during 2016 was compatible with  their independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Are there any significant accounting judgments or estimates  made by management in preparing the financial statements that  would have been made differently had the Independent Auditors  prepared and been responsible for the financial statements?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the Independent Auditors experience, and their  knowledge of the Company, do the Companys financial statements  fairly present to investors, with clarity and completeness, the  Companys financial position and performance for the reporting  period in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles  and SEC disclosure requirements?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Audited Financial Statements
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In its oversight role, the Audit Committee relies on the work and  assurances of the Companys management, which has the  responsibility for establishing and maintaining adequate internal  control over financial reporting and for preparing the financial  statements and other reports, and of the Independent Auditors,  who are engaged to audit and report on the consolidated financial  statements of the Company and subsidiaries and the effectiveness  of the Companys internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: and the Chief Financial Officer that the unaudited quarterly and  audited consolidated financial statements of the Company fairly  present, in all material respects, the financial condition, results of  operations and cash flows of the Company, and have expressed  to both management and the auditors their general preference for  conservative policies when a range of accounting options is available.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In reliance on these reviews and discussions, and the reports of the  Independent Auditors, the Audit Committee has recommended to  the Board of Directors, and the Board has approved, that the audited  financial statements be included in the Companys Annual Report  on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016, for filing  with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has reviewed and discussed with management and the Independent Auditors the audited financial statements in the Companys Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended December 31, 2016, including a discussion of the quality, not just the acceptability, of the accounting principles, the reasonableness of significant accounting judgments and estimates, and the clarity of disclosures in the financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addressing the quality of managements accounting judgments, members of the Audit Committee asked for managements representations and reviewed certifications prepared by the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ronald W. Allen, Chair Marc Bolland Richard M. Daley David B. Weinberg

sentences.text: Item 4 - Ratification of the Appointment of Ernst & Young LLP as Independent Auditors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ITEM 4 -   RATIFICATION OF THE APPOINTMENT OF ERNST &  YOUNG LLP AS INDEPENDENT AUDITORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What am I voting on?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareowners are being asked to ratify the appointment of Ernst & Young LLP, a registered public accounting firm, to serve  as the Companys Independent Auditors for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the Audit Committee has  the sole authority to appoint the Independent Auditors, as a matter of good corporate governance, the Board submits its  selection of the Independent Auditors to our shareowners for ratification.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the shareowners should not ratify the appointment  of Ernst & Young LLP, the Audit Committee will reconsider the appointment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting recommendation:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the ratification of the appointment of Ernst & Young LLP as Independent Auditors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has the sole authority and responsibility to  hire, evaluate and, where appropriate, replace the Companys  Independent Auditors and, in its capacity as a committee of the  Board, is directly responsible for the appointment, compensation  and general oversight of the work of the Independent Auditors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has appointed Ernst & Young LLP (EY) to serve  as Independent Auditors for the fiscal year ending December 31,  2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EY (including its predecessors) has served as the Companys  Independent Auditors since 1921.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Evaluation and Selection of Independent Auditors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee annually evaluates the performance of  the Companys Independent Auditors, including the senior audit  engagement team, and determines whether to reengage the current  Independent Auditors or consider other audit firms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Factors considered  by the Audit Committee in deciding whether to retain include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EYs independence;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the quality and efficiency of the services provided by EY, including  input from management on EYs performance and how effectively  EY demonstrated its independent judgment, objectivity and  professional skepticism;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EYs global capabilities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: external data on audit quality and performance, including recent  PCAOB reports on EY and its peer firms; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EYs technical expertise and knowledge of the Companys global operations and industry;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the appropriateness of EYs fees, EYs tenure as Independent  Auditors, including the benefits of a longer tenure, and the  controls and processes in place that help ensure EYs continued  independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the quality and candor of EYs communications with the Audit  Committee and management;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits of Longer Tenure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independence Controls
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee oversight  Oversight includes regular private sessions  with EY, discussion with EY about the scope of audit and business  imperatives, a comprehensive annual evaluation when determining  whether to reengage EY, and direct involvement by the Audit Committee  and its chair in the selection of the new lead assurance engagement  partner and new global coordinating partner in connection with the  mandated rotation of these positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Enhanced audit quality  EYs significant institutional knowledge and  deep expertise of the Companys global business, accounting policies  and practices and internal control over financial reporting enhance  audit quality.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Competitive fees  Because of EYs familiarity with the Company, audit  and other fees are competitive with peer companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Avoid costs associated with new auditor  Bringing on new Independent  Auditors would be costly and require a significant time commitment  which could lead to management distractions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Limits on non-audit services  The Audit Committee pre-approves audit  and permissible non-audit services provided by EY in accordance with  its pre-approval policy.

sentences.text: ITEM 5 -   SHAREOWNER PROPOSAL REGARDING  A HUMAN RIGHTS REVIEW
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The National Center for Public Policy Research, 20 F Street, NW, Suite 700, Washington, D.C. 20001, owner of 90 shares of Common Stock, submitted the following proposal:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Human Rights Review  High-Risk Regions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ereas, the Securities and Exchange Commission has consistently recognized that human rights constitute a significant policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company operations in high-risk regions with poor human rights records risk damage to Coca-Colas reputation and shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Coca-Cola has a presence in areas such as Qatar, Nigeria and the United Arab Emirates  all nations that have questionable human  rights records as it relates to womens rights and gay rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The companys operations in high-risk regions may worsen certain human rights abuses in those areas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Resolved: The proponent requests the board of directors review the companys guidelines for selecting countries / regions for its  operations and issue a report, at reasonable expense excluding any proprietary information, to shareholders by December 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The report should identify Coca-Colas criteria for investing in, operating in and withdrawing from high-risk regions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Supporting Statement: If the company chooses, the review may consider developing guidelines on investing or withdrawing from  areas where the government has engaged in systematic human rights violations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In its review and report, the company might also consider a congruency analysis between its stated corporate values and company  operations in certain regions, which raises an issue of misalignment with those corporate values, and stating the justification for  such exceptions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, the company is a member of Georgia Prospers, a business group that worked to defeat a religious freedom bill in  Georgia.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In a statement aimed at such religious freedom efforts, the company wrote, [a]s a business, it is appropriate for us to help  foster diversity, unity and respect among all people.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We advocate for inclusion, equality and diversity through both our policies and  practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Coca-Cola does not condone intolerance or discrimination of any kind anywhere in the world.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Yet, the Company maintains operations in high-risk regions where homosexual acts are criminalized.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proponent believes that Coca-Colas record to date demonstrates a gap between its statements and its actions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The requested report would play a role in illuminating and addressing the factors accounting for this gap.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 Proxy Statement    81
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: SHAREOWNER PROPOSAL
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 5 - Shareowner Proposal Regarding a Human Rights Review
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Statement Against Shareowner Proposal Regarding a Human Rights Review
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your Board of Directors recommends a vote AGAINST this proposal  because the review being requested is unnecessary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also recognizes that not every shareowner agrees with  every decision the Company makes, nor with every organization the  Company is involved with.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clearly, the proponent does not agree  with the Companys involvement with Georgia Prospers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2015,  the Company joined more than 500 other businesses in supporting  Georgia Prospers Business Coalition Pledge, which is a partnership  of businesses in the Companys home State of Georgia committed  to a prosperous Georgia that welcomes all people.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareowners can be assured that this Company is committed  to respecting human rights and that we apply that commitment  consistently around the world.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Company respects international  human rights principles aimed at promoting and protecting human  rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These include the United Nations Universal Declaration of  Human Rights, the International Labour Organizations Declaration on  Fundamental Principles and Rights at Work, and the United Nations  Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys  acknowledgement of these principles is consistent with our dedication  to enriching the workplace, preserving the environment, strengthening  the communities where we operate and engaging with stakeholders  to pursue progress toward these goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While we respect the proponents right to disagree with us on any  matter, the implication in this proposal that the Company is inconsistent  in its commitment and application of human rights is simply not  true.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, we believe the attempt to connect our engagement  with Georgia Prospers with a need for a human rights review of  high-risk regions is spurious.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage you to view the Companys policies related to Human  Rights by visiting our website, www.coca-colacompany.com/human- and-workplace-rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For all of the above reasons, the Board believes the review requested  in the proposal is unnecessary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends a vote AGAINST the shareowner  proposal regarding a human rights review.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Like the proponent, the Board agrees that all of our actions wherever  we operate should be aligned with our Companys values and vision  for success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: And the Board strongly believes they are.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
