sentences.text: ANNEX B - SUMMARY OF PLANS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following section provides information on Company-sponsored plans in which the Named Executive Officers participate that are noted  in the Compensation section.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement Plans  Pension
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TCCC Pension Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The TCCC Pension Plan is a broad-based tax- qualified defined benefit plan for substantially all U.S. non-union  employees of the Company and its participating subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A  participants benefit formula in the TCCC Pension Plan is dependent  on when the participant was hired and whether they were employed  by Coca-Cola Enterprises Inc. (CCE) before the Companys acquisition  of CCEs North American operations in 2010.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The information below  summarizes the provisions applicable to employees, including  the participating Named Executive Officers, who were hired by the  Company or its subsidiaries prior to 2010.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There are no special or  enhanced pension plans for the Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Limitations on Benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, a participant could receive no  more than $210,000 annually from the TCCC Pension Plan and no  compensation in excess of $265,000 per year could be taken into  account for calculating benefits under the TCCC Pension Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TCCC Supplemental Pension Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Supplemental pension plans  make employees whole when the Tax Code limits the benefit that  otherwise would accrue under the applicable pension plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  TCCC Supplemental Pension Plan also operates to keep employees  whole when they defer part of their salary or annual incentive under  the Deferred Compensation Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Otherwise, electing to defer would  reduce an employees retirement benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For employees hired prior to January 1, 2010, the benefit  vests after completing three years of service or attaining age 60  with one year of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vesting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vesting and benefits under the TCCC Supplemental Pension  Plan are calculated generally in the same manner as if the participants  otherwise eligible compensation or full annual benefit were able to  be paid from the TCCC Pension Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefit Formula.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to 2010, all pension benefits were based on a percentage of the employees final average compensation (the five highest consecutive years out of the last 11) up to the limit for each year as set by the Tax Code, multiplied by the employees years of credited service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective January 1, 2010, participants began accruing a pension benefit under a new cash balance formula (known as the Part B benefit).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants employed as of December 31, 2009 retained the pension benefit they accrued under the prior benefit calculation formula through December 31, 2009 (known as the Part A benefit) and were eligible for one or more special transition benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, beginning in 2010, a participants benefit was potentially based on two formulas, Part A (prior benefit calculation formula) plus Part B (new cash balance formula).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the cash balance formula, the Company makes an annual pay credit allocation to each active participants account on December 31, ranging from 3% to 8% of compensation, based on the participants age.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, on December 31 of each year, the Company makes an annual interest credit allocation based on the value of the participants account as of January 1 of the same year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees hired or rehired on or after January 1, 2012 accrue a pension benefit based on a different cash balance formula than described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payment of Benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits become payable upon separation  from service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The form of payment is dictated by the terms of the  plan and the participants age and years of service at the time of  separation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The cash balance portion of the TCCC Supplemental  Pension Plan is payable in a lump sum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The traditional pension  benefit portion is paid as an annuity if the participant separates  on or after the earliest retirement date (generally, age 55 with ten  years of service).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Otherwise, the traditional pension benefit portion  is paid as a lump sum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mobile Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Mobile Plan provides a retirement benefit to  globally mobile associates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Mobile Plan applies on the same  terms to the general population of international service associates  worldwide.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Mobile Plan, a globally mobile associates  account is credited with a monthly percentage of pay (pay credit)  and a defined rate of return (interest credit).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The pay credit is  generally 10% of pay, less any benefits provided by local retirement  plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both pay credits and interest credits are immediately vested.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A participant will continue to receive monthly interest credits for as  long as participation in the plan continues, even if the associate is  no longer on a global assignment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: International service associates  who participated in certain other plans were transitioned to the  Mobile Plan as of December 31, 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits accrued under such  other plans were converted to an opening balance in the Mobile  Plan as part of the transition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The term compensation for determining the pension benefit generally  includes salary, overtime, commissions and cash incentive awards,  but excludes any amounts related to stock options, PSUs, restricted  stock or restricted stock units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It also excludes deferred compensation  and any extraordinary payments related to hiring or termination of  employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payment of Benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When benefits become payable upon separation  from service, participants may choose between an annuity or a  lump sum option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The TCCC Pension Plan provides for payment of  a reduced benefit prior to normal retirement age and/or the current  cash balance amount, as applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ANNEX B - SUMMARY OF PLANS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement Plans  401(k) and Savings Plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: contribute according to their pensionable salary, in fixed percentages  according to applicable legislation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company triples the employee's  contribution to the general plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participation in the supplementary  plans is optional and being active in the general plan is a requirement  to contribute.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees can choose to contribute to the supplementary  plans from 1% to a maximum of 5% of their pensionable salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company matches contributions to supplementary plans into  an early retirement insurance policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vesting of these contributions  occurs upon fulfillment of applicable social security early retirement  rules, while still employed with the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, under the  Spanish Savings Plan, normal retirement age is 65 and benefits may  not be drawn before age 60.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 401(k) Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 401(k) Plan is a broad-based tax-qualified defined  contribution plan for most U.S. non-union employees of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company matches participant contributions up to a maximum  of 3.5% of the participants compensation or the amount allowable  under the limits imposed under the Tax Code, whichever is lower.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  Companys matching contribution is initially invested in Common Stock,  but participants may move the contribution to any other available  investment option.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees become 100% vested in Company  matching contributions after two years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, compensation  over $265,000 may not be taken into account under the 401(k) Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Supplemental 401(k) Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Supplemental 401(k) Plan makes  employees whole when the Tax Code limits the Company matching  contributions that otherwise would be credited to them under the 401(k)  Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Supplemental 401(k) Plan also operates to keep employees  whole when they defer part of their salary or annual incentive under  the Deferred Compensation Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company credits the employee  with the Company matching contributions in hypothetical share units  of Common Stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value of the accumulated share units, including  dividend equivalents, is paid in cash after separation from service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants are immediately vested in their benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees are  not permitted to make contributions to the Supplemental 401(k) Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: UK Savings Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The UK Savings Plan is a broad-based registered  defined contribution plan in which the majority of employees in the  UK participate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Plan participants must contribute a minimum of 2% of  pensionable salary on which the Company contributes 2.5 times the  employees contribution up to a maximum Company contribution of  15% of the participants pensionable salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There are no limits to the  amount of contributions that employees can make to their pension  account; however, tax effectiveness of contributions is limited by  both a lifetime allowance as well as an annual allowance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These  amounts have changed frequently over recent years and continue  to be subject to change.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 2015/2016 tax year, the annual  allowance was up to 40,000 and the lifetime allowance was 1  million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, under the plan, normal retirement age is 65 and  benefits may not be drawn before age 55.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Spanish Savings Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Spanish Savings Plan consists of a general plan and supplementary plans which are broad-based defined contribution plans that complement social security coverage provided in Spain for eligible employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the general plan, employees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentive Plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company maintains the Performance  Incentive Plan for employees above a specified grade level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  Performance Incentive Plan provides an annual cash payment based  on predetermined performance measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation  Committee may designate one or more performance measures from  the list contained in the plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Target annual incentives are established  for each participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payments are generally made in March in the  year following the applicable performance year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No participant may  receive an annual payment greater than $10 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Performance  Incentive Plan is designed to satisfy the requirements of Section 162(m)  of the Tax Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See page 52 for additional information about the  Performance Incentive Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options give the holder the right to purchase  shares of Common Stock at a specified price during specified time  periods.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The exercise price of an option may not be less than the fair  market value of Common Stock on the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The fair market  value is the average of the high and low prices of Common Stock  on the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In certain foreign jurisdictions, the law requires  additional restrictions on the calculation of the option price.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grants  provide that stock options generally may not be exercised during  the first 12 months after the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, options vest 25%  on the first, second, third and fourth anniversaries of the grant date  and have a term of ten years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys current compensation  programs include stock options as part of the annual long-term equity  compensation awards made to eligible employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Incentive Plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company maintains long-term  incentive plans for employees above a specified grade level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  following types of awards may be granted under the plans, as  designated by the Compensation Committee:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) stock options,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) PSUs,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) restricted stock and restricted stock units,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) other  performance awards, including performance cash awards and  qualified performance-based awards under Section 162(m) of the  Tax Code, payable in cash or Common Stock,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) stock appreciation  rights (SARs) and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) other stock-based awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company  currently has outstanding awards of stock options, PSUs, restricted  stock, restricted stock units and performance cash awards, which  are described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See page 53 for additional information about  long-term incentive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Share Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PSUs provide an opportunity for employees  to receive Common Stock if predetermined performance measures  are met for a predefined performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PSUs generally are  subject to an additional holding period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys current  compensation programs include PSUs as part of the annual long- term equity compensation awards made to eligible employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted Stock and Restricted Stock Units.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted stock awards  may be performance-based or time-based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares of stock are  granted and transferred into the employees name.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares remain  subject to forfeiture until the shares are released under the terms of  the awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted stock unit awards may be performance-based  or time-based and are settled in stock when all required criteria are
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 Proxy Statement 92 92
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ANNEX B - SUMMARY OF PLANS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees may or may not receive dividend equivalents during  the term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted stock and restricted stock units are not part of  the annual long-term equity compensation awards made to eligible  employees but may be awarded for limited purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Guidelines, in 2015, performance cash awards were incorporated  into the annual long-term incentive program for eligible employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employees who receive performance cash awards do not receive  equity awards as part of the annual long-term incentive program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No Named Executive Officers received performance cash awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Cash Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance cash awards provide an opportunity for employees to receive a cash award if predetermined performance measures are met for a predefined performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance cash awards generally are subject to an additional holding period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with the Equity Stewardship
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the 2014 Equity Plan provides the Compensation  Committee discretion to grant different types of equity awards,  including SARs and other stock-based awards such as unrestricted  shares, no such awards have been or are expected to be granted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: International Service Programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: International service program  benefits generally include relocation expenses, a housing allowance  (including certain housing expenses), a cost of living adjustment  (a cash adjustment designed to provide equivalent purchasing  power), certain cash allowances recognizing differences in living  conditions in the host location, a home leave allowance and currency  protection.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The programs also provide tax preparation services and  tax equalization, where applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There were approximately 550  participants in these programs in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deferred Compensation Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Deferred Compensation Plan  is a nonqualified and unfunded deferred compensation program  offered to approximately 1,000 U.S. based Company employees  in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: International service associates do not participate in the  Deferred Compensation Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligible participants may defer up  to 80% of base salary and up to 95% of their annual incentive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The  Company has the benefit of full unrestricted use of all amounts  deferred under the Deferred Compensation Plan until such amounts  are required to be distributed to the plan participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Gains and  losses are credited based on the participants election of a variety  of deemed investment choices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does not match any  employee deferral or guarantee a return.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants accounts  may or may not appreciate and may depreciate depending on  the performance of their deemed investment choices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of the  deemed investment choices provide returns at above-market or  preferential rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All deferrals are paid out in cash upon distribution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants may schedule a distribution during employment or may  opt to receive their balance after separation from service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Participants  who are considered specified employees under Section 409A of  the Tax Code (generally, the top 50 highest paid executives) may  not receive a post-termination distribution for at least six months  following separation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On occasion, the Company may provide a  one-time credit to the Deferred Compensation Plan to make up for  benefits lost under various circumstances, such as benefits lost at  a prior employer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has not provided any such credits  for any of the Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: TCCC Severance Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The TCCC Severance Plan provides cash  severance benefits to eligible employees who are involuntarily  terminated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eligible employees include regular, non-union, non- manufacturing U.S. employees and international service associates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Generally, benefits are payable when an employee is terminated  involuntarily due to specific circumstances such as an internal  reorganization or position elimination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits are not payable if  the employee is offered a comparable position with the Company  or one of its affiliates, is terminated for cause or has entered into  a separate agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benefit payable is determined based  on job grade level, salary and/or length of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The minimum  benefit is eight weeks of base pay and the maximum benefit is two  years of base pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ANNEX C - RECONCILIATION OF GAAP AND  NON-GAAP FINANCIAL MEASURES
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company reports its financial results in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States (GAAP or referred to herein as reported).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, management believes that certain non-GAAP financial measures provide users with additional meaningful financial information that should be considered when assessing our underlying business performance and trends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management also uses these non-GAAP financial measures in making financial, operating, compensation and planning decisions and in evaluating the Companys performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-GAAP financial measures should be viewed in
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: addition to, and not as an alternative for, the Companys reported  results prepared in accordance with GAAP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our non-GAAP financial  measures do not represent a comprehensive basis of accounting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For additional details regarding the reconciliation of GAAP and non- GAAP financial measures below, see the Companys Current Report  on Form 8-K filed with the SEC on February 9, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This information  is also available in the Investors section of the Companys website,  www.coca-colacompany.com.
